channel.title: Object Offset?
channel.description:
Okay, say my object is at 2409, 3417 (the most southern-western point of the object) and the object is 2x2 squares so ends at 2410 3418 (the most nothern-eastern point of the object), and I click the object at 2409 3419 || 2410 3419 it won't let me go down the tunnel unless I walk around the object to it's actual spawn point.
Is this where Offset comes in to play? If so, could someone let me know how to use it please?
My base is PI.
[URL=http://img263.imageshack.us/i/image1tg.png/][IMG]http://img263.imageshack.us/img263/8008/image1tg.png[/img][/URL]
So I want the object to initiate at the blue point but it only does once I walk around to the red point.
Thanks for reading.

item.title: Object Offset?
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:11, topic:385157”]Worked for me! I used the distance one as well. Going to experiment as only the left blue dot worked, not the right-hand side one.

Answered my own question LOL.[/quote]

i should thank you lol , because of this my projects got stalled xD

Read full topic

item.title: Object Offset?
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Worked for me! I used the distance one as well. Going to experiment as only the left blue dot worked, not the right-hand side one.

Answered my own question LOL.

EDIT: Success. I took away the object distance and it works for both. I’m guessing the distance method is just the distance from the spawn coords. ObjectYOffset = 2; meant if I was standing on the object Y spawn +2 it would initiate.

Read full topic

item.title: Object Offset?
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:9, topic:385157”]Packets > ClickObject.java

There’s the offset, it’s something to with there. So if I want to stand at X 3409 and the object is at X 3407 I’d use c.objectXOffset = +2;

I think. Going to try it now. ;)[/quote]

[code]switch(c.objectId) {
case 1733:
c.objectYOffset = 2;
break;

			case 3044:
				c.objectDistance = 3;
			break;
			
			case 245:
				c.objectYOffset = -1;
				c.objectDistance = 0;
			break;
			
			case 272:
				c.objectYOffset = 1;
				c.objectDistance = 0;
			break;
			
			case 273:
				c.objectYOffset = 1;
				c.objectDistance = 0;
			break;
			case 2561:
				c.objectYOffset = 1;
				c.objectXOffset = 2;
				c.objectDistance = 2;
			break;
			case 2560:
				c.objectYOffset = 4;
				c.objectXOffset = 2;
				c.objectDistance = 2;
			break;
			case 2564:
				c.objectYOffset = 5;
				c.objectXOffset = 1;
				c.objectDistance = 2;
			break;
			case 2562:
				c.objectYOffset = 5;
				c.objectXOffset = 1;
				c.objectDistance = 2;
			break;
			case 246:
				c.objectYOffset = 1;
				c.objectDistance = 0;
			break;
			
			case 4493:
			case 4494:
			case 4496:
			case 4495:
				c.objectDistance = 5;
			break;
			case 10229:
			case 6522:
				c.objectDistance = 2;
			break;
			case 8959:
				c.objectYOffset = 1;
			break;
			case 4417:
			if (c.objectX == 2425 && c.objectY == 3074)
				c.objectYOffset = 2;
			break;
			case 4420:
			if (c.getX() >= 2383 && c.getX() <= 2385){
				c.objectYOffset = 1;
			} else {
				c.objectYOffset = -2;
			}
			case 6552:
			case 409:
				c.objectDistance = 2;
			break;
			case 2879:
			case 2878:
				c.objectDistance = 3;
			break;
			case 2558:
				c.objectDistance = 0;
				if (c.absX > c.objectX && c.objectX == 3044)
					c.objectXOffset = 1;
				if (c.absY > c.objectY)
					c.objectYOffset = 1;
				if (c.absX < c.objectX && c.objectX == 3038)
					c.objectXOffset = -1;
			break;
			case 9356:
				c.objectDistance = 2;
			break;
			case 5959:
			case 1815:
			case 5960:
			case 1816:
				c.objectDistance = 0;
			break;
			
			case 9293:
				c.objectDistance = 2;
			break;
			case 4418:
			if (c.objectX == 2374 && c.objectY == 3131)
				c.objectYOffset = -2;
			else if (c.objectX == 2369 && c.objectY == 3126)
				c.objectXOffset = 2;
			else if (c.objectX == 2380 && c.objectY == 3127)
				c.objectYOffset = 2;
			else if (c.objectX == 2369 && c.objectY == 3126)
				c.objectXOffset = 2;
			else if (c.objectX == 2374 && c.objectY == 3131)
				c.objectYOffset = -2;
			break;
			case 9706:
				c.objectDistance = 0;
				c.objectXOffset = 1;
			break;
			case 9707:
				c.objectDistance = 0;
				c.objectYOffset = -1;
			break;
			case 4419:
			case 6707: // verac
			c.objectYOffset = 3;
			break;
			case 6823:
			c.objectDistance = 2;
			c.objectYOffset = 1;
			break;
			
			case 6706: // torag
			c.objectXOffset = 2;
			break;
			case 6772:
			c.objectDistance = 2;
			c.objectYOffset = 1;
			break;
			
			case 6705: // karils
			c.objectYOffset = -1;
			break;
			case 6822:
			c.objectDistance = 2;
			c.objectYOffset = 1;
			break;
			
			case 6704: // guthan stairs
			c.objectYOffset = -1;
			break;
			case 6773:
			c.objectDistance = 2;
			c.objectXOffset = 1;
			c.objectYOffset = 1;
			break;
			
			case 6703: // dharok stairs
			c.objectXOffset = -1;
			break;
			case 6771:
			c.objectDistance = 2;
			c.objectXOffset = 1;
			c.objectYOffset = 1;
			break;
			
			case 6702: // ahrim stairs
			c.objectXOffset = -1;
			break;
			case 6821:
			c.objectDistance = 2;
			c.objectXOffset = 1;
			c.objectYOffset = 1;
			break;
			case 1276:
			case 1278://trees
			case 1281: //oak
			case 1308: //willow
			case 1307: //maple
			case 1309: //yew
			case 1306: //yew
			c.objectDistance = 3;
			break;
			default:
			c.objectDistance = 1;
			c.objectXOffset = 0;
			c.objectYOffset = 0;
			break;		
		}
		if(c.goodDistance(c.objectX+c.objectXOffset, c.objectY+c.objectYOffset, c.getX(), c.getY(), c.objectDistance)) {
			c.getActions().firstClickObject(c.objectId, c.objectX, c.objectY);
		} else {
			c.clickObjectType = 1;
		}
		break;
		
		case SECOND_CLICK:
		c.objectId = c.getInStream().readUnsignedWordBigEndianA();
		c.objectY = c.getInStream().readSignedWordBigEndian();
		c.objectX = c.getInStream().readUnsignedWordA();
		c.objectDistance = 1;
		
		if(c.playerRights >= 3) {
			Misc.println("objectId: "+c.objectId+"  ObjectX: "+c.objectX+ "  objectY: "+c.objectY+" Xoff: "+ (c.getX() - c.objectX)+" Yoff: "+ (c.getY() - c.objectY)); 
		}
		
		switch(c.objectId) {
		case 6163:
		case 6165:
		case 6166:
		case 6164:
		case 6162:
			c.objectDistance = 2;
		break;
			default:
			c.objectDistance = 1;
			c.objectXOffset = 0;
			c.objectYOffset = 0;
			break;
			
		}[/code]

i think that’s it yeah =D
time to put it to a test =D

EDIT:
yup , finally i can finish my wizards tower xdxdxdxdxdxdxdxdxdxdxd
how to get it to work:
get the spawn coords of the object , then get the difference of the object spawn coord and the coord from where you want it to work

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Packets > ClickObject.java

There’s the offset, it’s something to with there. So if I want to stand at X 3409 and the object is at X 3407 I’d use c.objectXOffset = 2;

I think. Going to try it now.

item.title: Object Offset?
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:6, topic:385157”]Exactly! Same here lol. I’ve seen object offset before but never understood it. My theory is that it offsets the actual spawn point to be +1 or -1 and then creates a new “spawn point” so that you don’t have to be on the SW point to use the object.

When I find out what to do I’ll let you know. I think in ActionHandler you have to declare objectOffsetX = 1; or something like that…[/quote]

i think i remember seeing that somewhere too , someone’s really have to make an easier way to handle these big objects , i have the first and bottom floor of the wizards tower done , i cant get upstairs without having to stand outside the tower , next to the staircase <.<
but yeah , i’ll go mess around with some other methods , il post back here or send you a pm if i find anything that works =D

Read full topic

item.title: Object Offset?
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Exactly! Same here lol. I’ve seen object offset before but never understood it. My theory is that it offsets the actual spawn point to be +1 or -1 and then creates a new “spawn point” so that you don’t have to be on the SW point to use the object.

When I find out what to do I’ll let you know. I think in ActionHandler you have to declare objectOffsetX = 1; or something like that…

Read full topic

item.title: Object Offset?
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

i’ve spent an entire day trying every single method available to do the same with the cave entrance on waterbirth island to go to the dagannoth kings , nothing worked…

i tried :

  • to check the player’s position , if it’s in a good place and the player clicks the object it should move to where the object should bring him , FAILED
  • tried to use the inArea method to select the area in which the object stands ( and slightly bigger ) , if the player stands on that area and he clicks on the object , it should move the player , FAILED
  • did you notice that , it doesnt matter where you stand , you always get the message :"ObjectID , Object X , Object Y , etc?
    try looking for where that is placed and mess around with it , see if it works xD

Read full topic

Is this where Offset comes in to play? If so, could someone let me know how to use it please?
